name: Introduction to Engineering Design
description: This course provides an introduction to the engineering design process and the fundamentals of engineering analysis. Topics include design principles, materials selection, system analysis and synthesis, design iteration, and engineering ethics.

name: Introduction to Computer Programming
description: This course introduces students to the fundamentals of computer programming. Topics include algorithms, data structures, control structures, and object-oriented programming techniques.

name: Engineering Mathematics I
description: This course introduces the application of mathematical techniques to engineering problems. Topics include linear algebra, vector calculus, complex analysis, and numerical analysis.

name: Engineering Mechanics I
description: This course introduces the fundamentals of the mechanics of materials. Topics include statics, kinematics, dynamics, and mechanics of materials.

name: Engineering Mechanics II
description: This course introduces advanced topics in the mechanics of materials. Topics include advanced statics, kinematics, dynamics, and mechanics of materials.

name: Structural Analysis
description: This course introduces the fundamentals of structural analysis. Topics include stress analysis, buckling analysis, and vibration analysis.

name: Civil Engineering Design
description: This course introduces the fundamentals of civil engineering design. Topics include materials selection, structural systems, construction methods, and project management.
